values:
My answers, just in case anyone wants to read.  :)

01) Are you currently in a serious relationship? Married 15 years (jeez)
02) What was your dream growing up? To be a Naval Harrier pilot - and now I work in social services/PR/non-profits
03) What talent do you wish you had? Drawing/Painting
04) If I bought you a drink what would it be? Diet Coke (boring!)
05) Favorite vegetable? Broccoli
06) What was the last book you read? "The Historian" by Elizabeth Kostova
07) What zodiac sign are you? Pisces
08) Any Tattoos and/or Piercings? Explain where. Heh. 4 tats: right bicep, left ankle, lower back, and span shoulder to shoulder on back
09) Worst Habit? Smoking. I know - horrible habit.
10) If you saw me walking down the street would you offer me a ride? Yup.
11) What is your favorite sport? Volleyball played for 6 years in school.
12) Do you have a Pessimistic or Optimistic attitude? Both - depends on my mood at the time.
13) What would you do if you were stuck in an elevator with me? Become slightly hysterical, I hate enclosed spaces.
14) Worst thing to ever happen to you? Being misdiagnosed with bone cancer at 16. I was fine but the tests to be sure sucked royal.
15) Tell me one weird fact about you. I can't use public restrooms unless absolutely necessary lol.
16) Do you have any pets? 7 - 3 dogs, 1 cat, 1 fish, 1 frog, 1 turtle
17) What if I showed up at your house unexpectedly? You'd need to excuse the "lived in" look - otherwise come on over!
18) What was your first impression of me? Smart, centered, calm, with a hellavu lot of patience.
19) Do you think clowns are cute or scary? Eh. Cute probably.
20) If you could change one thing about how you look, what would it be? My weight - I used to be a nice slim size 10.
21) Would you be my crime partner or my conscience? Crime partner, I'm easily influenced!
22) What color eyes do you have? Hazel, green if I'm upset.
23) Ever been arrested? Nope.
24) Bottle or can soda? Can
25) If you won $10,000 today, what would you do with it? Buy a flat screen tv so the boys would shut up and save the rest for Jake's college.
27) What's your favorite place to hang out at? Home.
28) Do you believe in ghosts? Yep.
29) Favorite thing to do in your spare time? Watch movies or read
30) Do you swear a lot? Yah, I grew up on military bases.
31) Biggest pet peeve? People who are oblivious to other around them - the kind of people who will stop in the middle of the grocery aisle with their big ass carts so everyone has to wait for them to move.
32) In one word, how would you describe yourself? Contradictory.
33) Do you believe/appreciate romance? Sometimes, but it's not needed.
34) Favourite and least favourite food? Favorite: any seafood/Least: chicharrones (bleah)
35) Do you believe in God? I believe in many and the Goddess
36) Will you repost this so I can fill it out and do the same for you? Yup

Meet my gorgeous nephew, Macklen James, who just turned.......you guessed it, One!
Ahoy on my other blog, The Silent Road.  Link to the left!

to start again.

New post can be found at my other blog.  Because Gods know I can barely post at one, let alone two.  And cause it's prettier.  LOL 

thesilentroad.blogspot.com/

Okay, so it's a pompous title for this posting about nothing more than I 'm going to try to start posting again.  I got curious and checked out my own journal (I normally just log in to read from my friends list) and discovered I hadn't posted here since November of 2006.  Holy shit!  I didn't realize just how much time I've let pass - but that seems to be a theme for my life.  I don't know where time has gone:  Where have the past 34 years gone?  When did my son get to be almost 12 years old?   How is it possible I've been married to my husband for 15 years?!?  Time is going by and I'm just running to catch up and it's driving me crazy.  So, I'll try to start posting again and maybe, maybe it'll help me stop and recognize what's going on around me.

But.....since I'm out of practice and don't know what to write about.......I'll snag the meme going around and take some baby steps towards starting again.

1.  My username is ......................... because ...................
Ladynoah came from a period in our house when our pets literally came two-by-two: dogs, cats, fish, and frogs.  The numbers have come down since then (we still have 2 dogs but only 1 cat, fish, and frog left) I'm not changing it now.

2.  My name is ....................... because ...............................
Same as above - I never could be very creative!

3.  My journal is titled .................... because ......................................
"Finding Time" because I swear that's what I spend my whole life doing:  trying to find time for everything I want to do, see, experience, and discover.  Finding time to spend with my husband, enjoying my son, learning what I can, connecting with my family.........finding time is something I definitely wrestle with.

4.  My Friends page is called .................. because ........................
"La Ladies" because they come from all walks of life, backgrounds, personalities....but they are all, at the core, true ladies.  Comfortable with themselves, who they are, and best of all, WHAT they are.  The definition of a TRUE lady.

5.  My default userpic is ........................ because ............................
It's a stack of books - my favorite things in the world, next to loved ones.  I adore books, all shapes and sizes, all kinds and types.  I have them scattered everywhere, which drives my husband crazy.  But if I'm at a sitting postion, I've got a book in my hand: new ones, old ones, favorites and some I just didn't "get" the first time around.  I'm still searching for the perfect tattoo to illustrate that love.  Hopefully, one day I'll find it.

What else could bring me to post but the news that there's finally going to be some balance in the government?  It's been such a long imprisonment under the reactionary right-wing rule, I can literally feel some weight lift off of my shoulders.  Can sanity actually be close at hand?  Can I finally hope to see things coming out of Washington that doesn't embarass me as an American?  Goddess, please let it be so.  One of the most thankful events?  Rumsfield stepped down.  The man responsible for thousands of American deaths - the man responsible for thousands of Iraqi deaths........is gone.  Years late, but I'll take the victory for what it's worth.

Of course, the morons of the State of Texas re-elected Perry...but I'll take the small hit here at home in light of the nationwide blessings.  A million thanks to all who voted to bring these events to be.

I've been reading with interest the comments on <lj user="telaryn">'s journal entry regarding religion in today's society and the assumption of anyone outside of Abrahamic faiths being labeled "nonreligious".  Considering the current White House administration and it's obvious influence by and preference for Christianity, I don't think it's surprising that the mood of our country has continued to swing towards the "us versus them" mentality.  Turn on any tv, listen to any radio, read a column or a book, and the "it" thing today in the political world is to wear your religion like a badge of honor.  Every aspect of American life today and the rights that we were granted have become religious fodder:  the abortion debate, gay marriage, privacy issues, even the war currently being waged in Iraq have become innundated by terms like Biblical, moral, Divine punishment, and Godless.  Was this always there?  Or did it begin to insiduously creep across our country like a poison weed when Bush took office?  

I don't remember religion growing up.  We moved from post to post and life simply was people and places, not churches and religious mantles.  I don't know what religion our neighbors were - I didn't care.  They were just there, good and bad, living and working and being.  After reading the original entry and considering my own memories, I brought it up to my mom, thinking that perhaps it had been a child's blindness to the adult world that explained my lack of knowledge.  But, like me, Mom had no recollection of anyone's religion, except those who were close friends of theirs.  So when did it become acceptable to question someone on their religious beliefs?  When did it become normal for us to recite what church we attend and what God we believe in?

Personally, I have no religious belief, no Divine being that I worship.  I've explored many and found myself fascinated by each, with their complexities and rituals, their understanding and vision of the Divine: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Paganism, and more.  Each so beautiful and diverse, like beautiful quilts with each square containing a pattern that it would take a lifetime and more to explore.  But I don't identify with any and I don't know if I ever will.  Perhaps I haven't learned enough, opened myself enough, to let one immerse me in it's mysteries and capture my heart and spirit.  And despite the current societal beliefs, that doesn't bother me one bit.  As I grow older, I find that in my mind, one of my most valuable rights is the right to have, or not have, a religious belief.  It is a decision that is made with a person's mind, and heart, and soul, and that makes it infinitely precious.
A quick apology for the sand art picture - it came out HUGE!  Unfortunately, LJ is screwing with me and I can't downsize it right now.  I'll give it a shot later.

So, I once again fell behind on updating this sucker. I refuse to feel badly about it anymore. I just have no desire to put out anything that's going on in my life lately. Work seriously sucks, and it's depressing as hell - maybe that's why I've been feeling so blah lately. Satisfaction at work really can influence how your life, and you, feel. Let's just hope that it gets better soon. The one bright spot in the last couple of months was the short family vacation we took last weekend to Albuquerque. It was wonderful - no family, no one we know, just me, the Cop, and the Angel. We visited the zoo (twice, we're all animal freaks), the aquarium, the Natural History Museum, and Old Town. We woke up Sunday to find about an inch and a half of snow on the ground, which sent the Angel into ecstacy. Living in the desert, we don't get to see the white stuff very often, so I think that was the highlight of the trip for the little one. He had me out in our hotel courtyard at 7:00 a.m. in my pajamas while he ran wild and pitched snowballs at anything and everything - including his poor mother. We bought a couple of things that caught our eye: a handmade wall tile for Dia de los Muertos, with two skeletons playing cards, a small brass statue of Bast for me, and a gorgeous piece of Navajo sand art. That one made my day, it was the only thing I promised myself I would finally buy. I'm going to try to put a picture of it here, along with one of me and the Angel. Ignore my hair by the way, the wind was a bitch. Guess that's it for now. I'm reading everyone's LJ's and Blogs, by the way, and know that I'm sending vibes, wishes, and whatever else is asked for even if I don't say anything. Later!

As usual, I was trying to figure out what to post about.  I had an uneventful day, so that's a no go.  Then I caught the last bit of a movie the Cop was watching about Flight 93 from September 11th.  I don't watch shows about 9/11 anymore - I overdosed when it happened, glued to the television like everyone else in the country.  I just can't take seeing it again.

I never thought I'd live to see what I call a truly "historical event".  I wasn't alive for the first astronauts or the walk on the moon; I wasn't here for JFK's assassignation or Vietnam; D-Day and Pearl Harbor are events that I read about but I don't have the memories of seeing them happen.  The Twin Towers and all the events of that day, though, they live in my mind and have taken root.

I can remember where I was when I heard the reports, about 30 minutes after it began: in my car, on the way to work.  I remember that nothing got done that day as we all huddled around the tvs set up on various floors of the Department, watching everything unfold like it was a bad dream. I cried alot that day, and the days that followed, and I still have a difficult time grasping what a huge impact seeing it all made on me.  I was amazed to see how this entire country became united in a way I had not experienced in my lifetime.

Maybe that's why I have such an emotional reaction to the things that have come out of that terrible day.  The slow deterioration of our rights and liberties, the casual acceptance of harrasment and imprisonment of so many Muslims in our country, the war in Iraq, and even the ridiculous spending by some of the survivors of 9/11 victims.  Our internal government and many of our own countrymen have done more to damage this country than the terrorists could have ever aspired to do.  It breaks my heart and makes me furious at the same time.

It will be a day and a time that I will talk about with my grandchildren someday.  And I know that, like my grandparents and parents before me, I will never be able to fully convey this time.  Words, and stories, and pictures can tell the tale - but sometimes only through living it can you truly understand.  I just hope that when I do tell my story, I'm able to talk about it all in the past tense.  I want what I tell them to be incomprehensible, not something that they are living with.  That, in my mind, would make the whole tragedy something I can live with.

I may be in the right frame of mind to discuss my sister-in-law tonight. Though, if I notice I'm deteriorating into lengthy, nonsensical ramblings punctuated by curse words, I'm going to cut the post short. That's not out of the realm of possibility, believe me. I love her, I really do, but she is one of the most selfish, clueless, and laziest women I have ever met.

Since I met her (which was 13 years ago) she has never held a job. She lives in my mother-in-law's house. My mother-in-law pays most of the bills. And she has sworn up and down that once the littlest of her brood began school she would find a job to "help out". Well, R is in school and sis-in-law is now finding every excuse in the book why she can't even look for a job, let alone get one.

Part of the blame I know belongs to my MIL. She has never forced the issue, she has never made demands. Until now. Unfortunately, now is a little too late. SIL is set in her ways, and damned if she's going to change. I can understand MIL's instincts to help her daughter, and even more to make sure her grandchildren are well taken care of. But the woman is 65 years old and should be retired and enjoying her life. Instead, she's back working with CPS, 6 days a week, and busting her ass to make the money she needs to support so many people. My FIL is pissed, and is getting to the point that even hearing SIL's name makes him start cursing up a storm. And he's the most laid-back, easygoing man I've ever met. I think he hit the breaking point when SIL called the house last Saturday morning and, on hearing my MIL was at work, said an offhand "Poor lady." and promptly hung up. Completely clueless, I tell you.

I and the Cop hit our limit when one of the Cop's counsins called and said SIL had been asking him for money all day to pay the Electric Bill. Keep in mind, this is 3 weeks after the bill is due. She says MIL told her "Tough shit" and she needs the money. So, I go up to MIL's office so she can talk to the Cop. Turns out, SIL called MIL that morning and said that the electricity had been turned off, her new boyfriend was going to pay with a check, but they wouldn't take a check. MIL tells her to have the boyfriend cash the check, and problem solved. This was first thing in the a.m. SIL then calls MIL at 4:00 in the afternoon to say she needs the money. MIL indeed tells her too bad, she's at work, can't leave until 5:00, what the hell is she supposed to do about it? A bit different than SIL's "poor, poor, pitiful me" story to the cousin. MIL was so upset to hear what SIL was doing that she was almost in tears. Add in that we find out from 2nd SIL that 1st SIL had a damn party 3 days before that phone call, and that was enough for the Cop and I.

How do you deal with someone like this? It's not like we can cut ties. She's family, she's the somewhat mother to our nieces and nephews. But she lies so much and causes such stress in the family I'd like to kick her ass. That's not really conductive to tranquil family relations. She's 43 years old and seems convinced that everyone owes her something because she was able to spread her legs so many more times than the rest of us.  Hmm, did I mention she had 13 children?  And that if she doesn't get what she thinks she deserves she doesn't let the kids come visit any of us?  That's our punishment.  So how do you untangle those family ties without giving them enough time to eventually choke the life out of you?

So, since I have been shamelessly requesting book recommendations, I thought it might be a good idea to post up what I already have in my little, tiny library.  I did some scouting last year when I started stepping away from the RC and hit all the used bookstores for books that caught my eye.  I think I read 2 of them and then wandered away from it when the imbeded RC guilt caught me in a stranglehold.  Luckily, I didn't feel guilty enough to get rid of them (perish the thought!) and maybe they'll be worth a look.  So, my current list:

1.  Drawing Down the Moon - Margot Adler
2.  Witchcraft From the Inside - Raymond Buckland
3.  The God of the Witches - Margaret A. Murray
4.  Wicca - Vivianne Crowley
5.  Keepers of the Flame - Morganna Davies and Aradia Lynch
6.  Spiral Dance - Starhawk
7.  Maiden, Mother, Crone - D.J. Conway
8.  Wicca, A Guide for the Solitary Practitioner - Scott Cunningham

The two I got through were Witchcraft from the Inside and Keepers of the Flame, which I really enjoyed.  But, like I mentioned before, most, if not all, focus on Wicca.  I really, really want more general Paganism, and I'll definitely look up Hutton (thanks, Sarff!).  But I can always use more... :::shameless hinting:::

Ta da!!

You wouldn't believe how long it took me to make just those few adjustments to this sucker.  I have got to spend some time online learning how to do this stuff.  Everyone makes it look so easy and it's sooooo not.  I'm not even going to get into how everyone figures out how to make header boxes, colors, and on and on and on.  I'll get there, it's just going to take me awhile.

You'll notice I haven't been updating like I'm supposed to ::slaps own hand:: but I've just been too lazy.  It was a good weekend, nothing exciting going on, but that's the way I like it.  I did spend a good amount of time going through Barnes and Nobles to figure out where to spend my Christmas giftcard.  I did get the book suggested by Laura ::waves:: and then bought a couple of general books on Paganism.  I've given up on trying to fit myself into Catholicism, and since I've been drawn towards Pagan paths, I'm going to do some serious reading.  I'm also going to spend some time concentrating on myself and letting my guilt over cutting myself off from the RC go.  Maybe then I'll be able to hear Someone else calling me.  We'll see.

In other news, my sister-in-law is a worthless bitch.  I've got plenty to say on that subject, but I don't feel like getting into it tonight.  Maybe later - it's better if I don't go to sleep with that subject on my mind.  Night!

Once more, my broooooaaaaddd resolution to post whenever I come online is coming to my rescue! If ya got no interest, keep it a'movin.
You Were a Snake
You have a primal energy that drives you to explore the mysteries of life. A nearly immortal soul, you'll live a very long life.
What Animal Were You In a Past Life?
Oh, baby, I have such a loverly mental image of calling Johnny Depp my Daddy! LOL
Your Daddy Is Johnny Depp
What You Call Him: Papi Why You Love Him: He's the Mack Daddy
Who's Your Daddy?

to keep my promise of updating everytime I come online.  I just about blew it off tonight because I can't think of a damn thing to post.  It was a regular day, no more and no less, and nothing worthy of note to discuss.  But, I updated!  Good thing I kept my resolution as broad as possible, isn't it?

I'm so damn bored with everything right now, I don't know what to do with myself.  I'm crocheting like crazy, just to keep my hands busy and my mind occupied.  I need something that will capture my interest and not let go.  I need to escape for awhile.

Man, I need to go spend my B&N gift card!!  Just 3 more days and I'll have some new, glorious books.

Back to work I went.  The Cop and I played alarm clock ring-around-the-rosie this morning for 30 minutes before we finally hauled ourselves out of bed.  The Angel (who was wandering the halls at 12:30 last night) took some coaxing, but woke up fairly well, considering our wake-up time was around 10 a.m. the last 3 weeks.

I met my new boss this morning, something I've been ambivilant about.  I've been doing her position as well as my own for over 4 years, yet didn't rate an interview when the position came open.  You could have found my picture in the dictionary under "motherfuckingpissed" in December because of that little maneuver, but I've moved past it and into the "what-the-hell-it-means-less-work-for-me" stage.

She's very nice, and seems very competent and eager to help out however she can.  I could use the help, without a doubt, but it'll always grate a bit.  Added to that our Regional Director and the Higher Ups want her to shadow me until April, so she can learn her new position.  Can you hear my eyes rolling out of my head at that one?  Yeah.  

The one surprise was the rave reviews I've evidently gotten from all the Higher Ups and caseworkers - color me astonished.  Most of the time all I hear are the complaints, so I appreciate the compliments, even if they are secondhand.  I'll take what I can get.

All in all, not a bad start back.  Now, I just have to get back into the swing.

We had a great time last night.  There were 7 of us playing poker all night, finally breaking up at 5:30 this morning.  Gah.  By the time we picked up and went to sleep it was just after 6 a.m.  We started playing around 10 p.m. with the $10 buy-in and at cash out time we were only out about $3, so not bad for a nights entertainment.

Unfortunately, I woke up feeling like hell this afternoon.  Considering I didn't drink that much I'm rather ticked.  The Cop gave me some asprin before he left to pick up the Angel, and a nap and a shower helped some.  My sinuses are going nuts and my throat is sore, so I'm guessing I've managed to pick up something.  I've got to get back into the office tomorrow, so I'll take some Nyquil tonight and hope that knocks most of it out.

I'm definitely feeling the blahs (vacation ending letdown and this bug), so I'm going to cuddle up with some movies and zone out for my last day of freedom.  Later!

We've restarted our normal routine today.  The Angel went back to Catechism this morning, which we were about 6 minutes late for, and I think Monday is going to be a horror.  None of us are used to getting up early anymore and having to be back on a time schedule is a bitch.

I admit I'm getting annoyed with having to get up on my Saturdays to take the boy to the Church.  Considering I've basically dropped all Catholic beliefs that I once held, I feel a bit hypocritical having him attend.  But, he enjoys it, he has an amazing faith in God, and I use that to comfort myself with him learning a belief that I want no part in.  Plus, it's generated some great discussions between us regarding other faiths (my deepest appreciation, RI Ladies) and I think it's giving him a more balanced view of religion.  

It's a bit disconcerting to tell him about other Gods/Goddesses/beliefs and have him accept what I say without a qualm.  I'm so glad that he trusts me that much, but it's given me a greater understanding of how children can get so completely screwed up by their parents' beliefs.  I just hope that I'm leading him in the right direction.  I think I am:  he considers school supported prayer "stupid" and calls Bush "that idiot".  ::snort::  I just want him to keep asking for more information when he hears things, rather than accepting that first idea as the whole picture.

Anyway, we've got a card party tonight - $10.00 buy in which usually lasts us for 5 hours or so.  I'll have a house full of people, a ton of booze, and non-stop laughter.  I'm really looking forward to it - I even cleaned my house!  Speaking of which, it's time to start getting ready.  Later!

I'm feeling so lazy today, I just can't get myself motivated.  I have an SUV full of donations for Goodwill and since the Christmas tree pickup service fell through, I'm stuck finding a place to take it myself.  Add in a boy who doesn't want to get dressed and it's a recipe for disaster.

Question:  How the hell does everyone think of something to write everyday?  I get online a couple of times a day to check in on all my favorites, and I'm lucky enough that no one lets me down.  Day in and day out, I can find posts to laugh at, cry over, ponder, or enjoy - I take it for granted, I know.  Everytime I log in, I tell myself I'm going to write something and yet I rarely do.  I can't think of anything interesting enough to put in here!  I feel like I'm taking without giving back, and that's really beginning to bother me.  So, my ONLY new year's resolution will be to post an entry when I come online.  Even if it's just a one-line wonder.  I still have to work out the logistics of whether it'll be here or on my Blog, but I'll worry about that later.

I'm on the last days of my 3 week vacation and for the first time, I'm going to return to work feeling like I actually accomplished something.  The house is almost recovered from Christmas (the interior is done but the outside isn't - the Cops domain, Lady don't do heights), I've finished most of the inside projects I was aiming for, and tomorrow I'll finish the garage.  I'm so sick of all the STUFF in my house - it was taking over and I'm determined to have some space back.

My house, despite my boys, has been lonely lately.  Two days before Christmas my baby, Licorice, my 1 year old cat, got out of the house and disappeared.  We spent over 4 hours that night looking for her and despite calls to Animal Control and signs in the neighborhood, we haven't found her.  We know someone has her, she's an indoor cat and the one other time she got out we found her in the backyard with the dogs.  If she'd been picked up by Animal Control she's microchiped with our information and we'd have been contacted.  I'm sick about it.  Despite the fact we got her and her sister (who died at only 4 months old) for the Angel, Licorice was mine.  She followed me around the house, she came to find me when she was hungry, and she slept on my head - I'm still having a hard time sleeping without that weight on me.  I just hope that whoever has her is taking good care of her.  Everyone keeps asking if I'm getting another cat, but I just can't think about it yet.  I'm still waiting to have her come home - a hopeless wish, maybe, but I can't bring another cat in here yet.  I still have her food dish full and I started to wash her window bed, but I couldn't do it.

To occupy myself, I'm teaching myself to crochet.  Strangely enough, I'm really enjoying it.  I've got many of the basic stitches down, so I'm making the Angel a small throw.  Wine colored chenille yarn with black chenille tril between each panel and bordering the edges.  I've got about a 1/4 of it finished and it's not bad.  I'm screwing up a bit on the counting (who can keep track of that!?) but not enough to be hugely noticable.  That's why I gave the Angel first choice - he won't be picky.  Maybe by the time I'm finished I'll have a way to post a pic.

Hmm, I had more to say than I thought.  Guess that's it for today, I'm going to hit the sheets.  Night!

I just jumped off of another post, but this was too funny not to post.
Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

Last Friday I helped hide a body (-173 points). Last Saturday I bought porn for (-10 points). In August I ruled Iran as a cruel and heartless dictator (-700 points). Last Sunday I broke 's X-Box (-12 points). In November I farted in an elevator (-6 points).

Overall, I've been naughty (-901 points). For Christmas I deserve a spanking!

Sincerely,
ladynoah

I'm still too lazy to write any entries, but I couldn't pass up saying,


Happy Birthday, <lj user="telaryn">!!

I hope your day was a wonderful one.
Hell is full of people with Big Hair
